page.title: 04Baby clinic
page.content: On Wednesday 1st. May we interveiwed Miss Kellard about the baby clinic.The baby clinic is a place where babies go to have thier weight checked and have thier injections .To be a health visitor you need to be a qualified nurse and do a special course. The health visitor that comes to Blockley prefers small villages to large towns. The baby clinic has been running for 11 years, but before the war there was an infant welfare clinic.If a baby was ill at clinic Miss Kellard would send it to a local doctor or hospital if needed. The clinic is held at the St. Georges Hall, Blockley once per month.
